availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Parish G. Reese (Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer & Col 45th Reg KY Militia)

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sallie A. Oldacre Reese. Father of Sarah F. Reese, Lillie A. A. Reese, and Lauriston L. Reese. Served in the 45th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) as colonel in Grayson County in 1863 and 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 2, p. 252B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell District p. 683.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Leitchfield Precinct, p. 353A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1965), KDLA, Film #994027-994058: Jefferson, Russell County Births, 1855, p. 1 of 4 of microfilm (accessed through Ancestry.com).
W. Stephen McBride, “The Union Occupation of Munfordville, Kentucky, 1861-1865: A Narrative Summary,” (Lexington, Kentucky), 46-47.
KYR-0002-022-0023.
